docs.title: Welcome to Fivemon
docs.text:
Fivemon is a comprehensive mod/resource set for FiveM, featuring a custom framework at its core called uri-core. This state-of-the-art framework is highly optimized and offers a wide array of customization options, easy translation, and seamless content addition through simple files or even its own custom language, .uri. This language allows developers to create advanced NPCs, quests, and logic-rich gameplay elements to enhance the player experience. Fivemon is also equipped with a powerful Pokémon mechanics addon, supporting an advanced battle simulator.

In the Fivemon Wiki, you'll be able to dive into learning .uri starting with the introduction. In the core and pokemon sections, you'll find up to four main categories: guides, resources, extensions, and utilities. In guides, you can explore various topics to help you learn or better understand different aspects of the game. In resources, you'll have access to several repositories containing server content, such as items, Pokémon, abilities, and more. The extensions section provides additional functionalities for .uri, including new actions and constructors. Finally, in utilities, you'll find commands, configuration files, and control schemes to manage and customize your experience.

Explore this page to discover all the exciting features Fivemon has to offer.

docs.title: Pokémon Team
docs.text:
Each player has access to an advanced Pokémon team, allowing them to easily view and manage their team. The interface is user-friendly, offering a clear view of each Pokémon's stats, abilities, and moves.

Fivemon includes all the essential mechanics needed for modern Pokémon gameplay, including stats like EVs, IVs, natures, and abilities. Pokémon can evolve, level up, and participate in complex battles, all within a flexible and immersive system. We have pokemon up to the second generation included, but the mod itself supports up to the latest generations.

docs.title: Pokémon PC
docs.text: Players can also utilize a fully configurable PC system with filters to help organize and search for Pokémon. For example, you can filter Pokémon based on whether they can learn a specific TM, change box colors, and much more.

docs.title: Pokémon Interactions
docs.text: Players can carry their Pokémon and interact with them organically by throwing them out, recalling them, or having them follow in a natural, fluid manner.

docs.title: Advanced Spawn System
docs.text: Fivemon's spawn system is highly configurable, determining which Pokémon appear in each area based on biomes, time of day, weather conditions, and rarity tiers. This makes rare Pokémon encounters even more special and exciting.

docs.title: Pokédex
docs.text: Players have access to a Pokédex, allowing them to track their progress as trainers. They can use the Pokédex to capture information using the in-game camera or their Pokémon list. The Pokédex provides valuable insights into their journey.

docs.title: Skins for Pokémon
docs.text: Fivemon introduces a unique system for custom Pokémon skins, allowing players to customize their Pokémon and enhance their connection with their team. This feature adds a personal touch, making the gameplay experience even more rewarding.

docs.title: Flexible Battle System
docs.text:
The battle system in Fivemon is extremely flexible, allowing for a variety of battle formats. You can have battles with up to four teams, and each team can have up to six Pokémon. This means you can create battles like 2v2, 3v3, or even free-for-alls like 1v1v1v1. The possibilities are endless. NPCs, wild Pokémon, mission Pokémon, or players can all participate in battles.

The battle interface is user-friendly, showing all the relevant information needed to manage the battle. Additionally, spectators can watch battles by simply standing near them, encouraging player interaction.

docs.title: Gym Badges
docs.text: Fivemon includes a Gym and Badge system, where players can take on Gym Leaders and collect badges as they work towards becoming the Champion. This structured challenge adds a competitive layer to the experience, motivating players to rise through the ranks.

docs.title: Customization for Playmakers
docs.text: Fivemon offers a wide range of commands for playmakers to customize the experience. Whether it’s creating custom Pokémon, designing new items like custom potions or Pokéballs, or setting up unique zones that only players with specific qualifications can access, the possibilities are endless.

docs.title: Custom Zones
docs.text: You can create zones that only trainers with certain achievements or levels can enter. For example, you might have a special area for players above level 50 where rare and powerful Pokémon appear.

docs.title: Custom Achievements
docs.text: You can also define achievements for players, such as defeating 50 wild Pokémon or completing the Pokédex. These achievements can be tied to zones, creating a progression system that rewards dedicated players.

docs.title: Custom Content
docs.text: Using .uri, you can create custom NPCs with personalized dialogues and behaviors. For instance, you could design an evil duo that blocks access to a specific area until they are defeated in a 2v2 battle. You can even create raid battles with Pokémon levels over 1000, encouraging community teamwork to achieve a shared goal.

docs.title: Pokemon Skills
docs.text: In Fivemon, your Pokémon aren't just battle companions—they can also assist you in exploring the world in exciting ways. You can fly through the skies on the back of a flying-type Pokémon, surf across the water, or even dive into the depths with a water-type. Additionally, with certain Pokémon have the ability to ride them or you can carry them.

docs.title: Core Framework Features
docs.text:
Beyond the Pokémon content, uri-core provides a powerful framework with features such as:

  • A custom loading screen that displays user information.
  • A custom character loading system.
  • An advanced inventory system with window-based navigation.
  • A pause/personal menu that centralizes everything a player needs to navigate the world easily. Organizations, quests, quest group, settings...

docs.title: Endless Possibilities
docs.text:
Fivemon gives you all the tools to create your own world. Whether you want to develop an advanced Pokémon ecosystem, build a thriving player community, or design intricate NPC interactions, Fivemon is here to help you achieve it. The only limit is your imagination.

What are you waiting for? Join us on Discord!

docs.title: Actions
docs.text: Name Type Description Possibilities ask interaction Presents a question to the player with a set of possible responses. The result is the index of the chosen response. 2 beRescued behaviour Allows an NPC to be rescued by a player. The NPC will follow the player to a specified rescue position. 3 blockForceInteraction interaction Blocks an NPC from forcing an interaction with a specific character. 1 clear both Stops the NPC from performing any current tasks or animations. 1 combat behaviour Engages the NPC in combat with a specified target. 2 combatClosestPlayer behaviour Engages the NPC in combat with the closest player within a specified distance. 2 command interaction Executes a specified command on the client side. 1 cower both Makes the NPC cower in fear. 1 dice both Rolls a dice with the specified number of faces and returns a random result. 1 distanceCoordsClose both Checks if the NPC is within a specified distance from a given set of coordinates. 2 distanceEntityClose both Checks if the NPC is within a specified distance from a given entity. 2 do both Executes a behaviour tree. 1 driveToCoords behaviour Makes the NPC drive a vehicle to the specified coordinates. 2 driveToEntity behaviour Makes the NPC drive a vehicle towards a specified entity. 2 enterClosestVehicle behaviour Makes the NPC enter the closest vehicle within a specified distance. 3 enterVehicle behaviour Makes the NPC enter a specified vehicle. 2 flee behaviour Makes the NPC flee from a specified pedestrian if they are within a certain distance. 2 fleeCoords behaviour Makes the NPC flee from specified coordinates if they are within a certain distance. 2 forceInteraction behaviour Forces an interaction between the NPC and a nearby player. If blockForceInteraction has been used on a player, the NPC won't interact with that player until unblockForceInteraction is used. 2 getClosestPlayer behaviour Finds the closest player to the NPC within a specified distance and stores the player entity in a global variable. 2 getClosestVehicle behaviour Finds the closest vehicle to the NPC within a specified distance, optionally filtered by model and flag, and stores the vehicle entity in a global variable. 1 getCombatTarget behaviour Retrieves the NPC's current melee combat target and stores the target entity in a global variable. 2 getGlobalState both Retrieves a global state associated with the NPC and stores it in a global variable within the behavior tree." 1 getLocalState interaction Retrieves a local state associated with the NPC and the specific player, then stores it in a local variable within the behavior tree. 1 getNPC both Retrieves an NPC by its ID from the NPC repository and stores it in a global variable. 2 give interaction Gives a specified item and quantity from the NPC to the character. 2 giveUbication interaction Sets a new waypoint on the map at the specified coordinates. 1 globalCheck both Checks if a global state for the NPC is already marked. If not marked, it sets the state and returns 1; if already marked, it returns 2. 2 goToClosestPlayer behaviour Makes the NPC move towards the closest player within a specified distance and speed. 3 goToCoords behaviour Makes the NPC move towards the specified coordinates. 2 goToEntity behaviour Makes the NPC move towards a specified entity within a given distance and speed. 2 goToEntityOffset behaviour Makes the NPC move to a position offset from a specified entity by a given X and Y distance. 2 if both Evaluates a given value as a condition and returns a result based on whether the value is true or false. 2 input interaction Prompts the player to input a text value, which is then stored in a local variable. 2 knows interaction Checks if the NPC recognizes or knows the character. 2 localCheck interaction Checks if a local state for the NPC related to a specific player is already marked. If not marked, it sets the state and returns 1; if already marked, it returns 2. 2 log both Logs a message to the client's debug console. 1 lookCoords behaviour Makes the NPC turn to face a specific set of coordinates. 2 lookEntity behaviour Makes the NPC turn to face a specified entity. 2 me interaction Displays an action message from the NPC in the chat, typically used for roleplaying purposes. 1 nothing both Does nothing. 1 openCraftingTable interaction Opens a specified crafting table interface for the player. 1 openShop interaction Opens a specified shop interface for the player. 1 openStorage interaction Opens a specified storage interface for the player. 1 playAnimation behaviour Plays a specified animation on the NPC. 2 playingAnimation condition Checks if the NPC is currently playing a specified animation. 2 remove interaction Removes a specified item and quantity from the NPC to the character. 2 return both Ends the current action sequence and returns a specified result. 1 serverLog both Logs a message to the server console with the 'Action' tag for debugging purposes. 1 set both Sets multiple global variables within the behavior tree. 1 setCoords behaviour Sets the NPC's position to the specified coordinates. 2 setGlobalState both Sets a global state for the NPC. 1 setLocalState interaction Sets a local state for the NPC related to a specific player. 1 setWalk behaviour Sets the NPC's walking style to the specified animation set. 1 startQuest interaction Initiates a quest for the NPC. This action handles starting, rewarding, or failing the quest depending on the player's progress. 7 surround behaviour Positions the NPC around a specified entity, calculating an offset based on the number of people surrounding and the NPC's position among them. 1 teleport behaviour Teleports the NPC to the specified entity if the entity is not within a certain distance. 2 tell interaction Displays a message to the player from the NPC. 1 unblockForceInteraction interaction Allows an NPC to force an interaction with a specific character again by unblocking it. 1 wait behaviour Pauses the NPC's behaviour for a specified duration. 2 wander behaviour Makes the NPC wander within a specified area, randomly moving around a central point. 1

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Presents a question to the player with a set of possible responses. The result is the index of the chosen response.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 title string Yes The question or title to be presented to the player. No 2 answer string Yes The possible responses to the question. The number of responses is optional. Yes

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The index of the selected response. 2 If the player cancels, the result is the index after the last option.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name NPC 
  model a_m_m_eastsa_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    ask "What will you do?" Fight Run 
      tell "You chose to fight." 
      tell "You chose to run." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Allows an NPC to be rescued by a player. The NPC will follow the player to a specified rescue position.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate of the rescue position. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate of the rescue position. No 3 z number Yes The Z coordinate of the rescue position. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 1 if the NPC is already at the rescue position. 2 2 if the NPC is following the player. 3 3 if the NPC is waiting where they are.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Hostage 
  model a_m_m_farmer_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    beRescued 100.0 200.0 300.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Blocks an NPC from forcing an interaction with a specific character.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    blockForceInteraction 
      tell "This NPC can no longer force interactions with you." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Stops the NPC from performing any current tasks or animations.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    clear

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Engages the NPC in combat with a specified target.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 target Entity Yes The target that the NPC will engage in combat. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The target is already dead. 2 The NPC engages in combat with the target.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Enemy 
  model g_m_y_ballaorig_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 10 
      combat $player

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Engages the NPC in combat with the closest player within a specified distance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 distance number No The maximum distance within which the NPC will engage the closest player. Defaults to 15 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC engages in combat with the closest player. 2 No player is within the specified distance, or the NPC cannot engage.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    combatClosestPlayer 20

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Executes a specified command on the client side.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 command string Yes The command to be executed. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The command has been executed.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    command "me stares intently" 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Civilian 
  model a_f_m_skidrow_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    cower

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Rolls a dice with the specified number of faces and returns a random result.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 faces integer Yes The number of faces on the dice. Accepts any positive integer. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The result of the dice roll, a random number between 1 and the specified number of faces.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    dice 4 
      tell "You rolled the number 1." 
      tell "You rolled the number 2." 
      tell "You rolled the number 3." 
      tell "You rolled the number 4." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks if the NPC is within a specified distance from a given set of coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 distance number Yes The maximum distance within which the NPC should be to return a positive result. No 2 x number Yes The X coordinate to check against. No 3 y number Yes The Y coordinate to check against. No 4 z number Yes The Z coordinate to check against. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is within the specified distance. 2 The NPC is not within the specified distance.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    distanceCoordsClose 5.0 100.0 200.0 300.0 
      tell "The NPC is close to the specified location." 
      tell "The NPC is not close to the specified location." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks if the NPC is within a specified distance from a given entity.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 distance number Yes The maximum distance within which the NPC should be to return a positive result. No 2 entity Entity Yes The entity to check the distance against. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is within the specified distance from the entity. 2 The NPC is not within the specified distance from the entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 10 
      distanceEntityClose 5.0 player 
        tell "The NPC is close to the player." 
        tell "The NPC is not close enough to the player."

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 behaviour BehaviourID Yes The ID of the behaviour tree to execute. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The last node result in the behaviour tree.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
BEHAVIOURTREE 

  name example_behaviour 

  interaction 
    tell "Hi, how are you?" 

  NPC 

  name NPC_1 
  model a_m_m_eastsa_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    do example_behaviour

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC drive a vehicle to the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 vehicle Vehicle Yes The vehicle the NPC will drive. No 2 x number Yes The X coordinate to drive to. No 3 y number Yes The Y coordinate to drive to. No 4 z number Yes The Z coordinate to drive to. No 5 distance number No The stopping distance from the coordinates. Defaults to 10.0 if not specified. No 6 speed number No The speed at which the NPC should drive. Defaults to 26.0 if not specified. No 7 mode number No The driving mode to use. Defaults to 786468 if not specified. https://vespura.com/fivem/drivingstyle/ No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the coordinates. 2 The NPC driving to the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Driver 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestVehicle vehicle 
      driveToCoords $vehicle 150.0 200.0 300.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC drive a vehicle towards a specified entity.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 vehicle Vehicle Yes The vehicle the NPC will drive. No 2 entity Entity Yes The entity to which the NPC will drive. No 3 distance number No The stopping distance from the entity. Defaults to 10.0 if not specified. No 4 speed number No The speed at which the NPC should drive. Defaults to 26.0 if not specified. No 5 mode number No The driving mode to use. Defaults to 786468 if not specified. See more details at https://vespura.com/fivem/drivingstyle/ No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the entity. 2 The NPC starts driving towards the entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name TaxiDriver 
  model s_m_m_taxidriver_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 
      getClosestVehicle vehicle 
        driveToEntity $vehicle $player

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC enter the closest vehicle within a specified distance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 vehicle Entity Yes The global variable name where the vehicle entity will be stored. No 2 distance number Yes The maximum distance within which the NPC should look for a vehicle. No 3 seatIndex number No The seat index the NPC should attempt to enter. Defaults to the driver's seat if not specified. No 4 speed number No The speed at which the NPC should enter the vehicle. Defaults to 2.0 if not specified. No 5 timeout number No The time in milliseconds to wait before giving up on entering the vehicle. Defaults to -1 (no timeout) if not specified. No 6 mode number No The mode of entry. Defaults to 1 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already in or entering a vehicle. 2 The NPC starts entering the closest vehicle. 3 No vehicle was found within the specified distance.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Thief 
  model a_m_y_hipster_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    enterClosestVehicle myVehicle 15.0 0 2.0 -1 1

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC enter a specified vehicle.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 vehicle Vehicle Yes The vehicle that the NPC will enter. No 2 seatIndex number No The seat index the NPC should attempt to enter. Defaults to -1 (any seat) if not specified. No 3 speed number No The speed at which the NPC should enter the vehicle. Defaults to 2.0 if not specified. No 4 timeout number No The time in milliseconds to wait before giving up on entering the vehicle. Defaults to -1 (no timeout) if not specified. No 5 mode number No The mode of entry. Defaults to 1 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already in or entering the specified vehicle. 2 The NPC starts entering the specified vehicle.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Driver 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    enterVehicle myVehicle -1 2.0 -1 1

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC flee from a specified pedestrian if they are within a certain distance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 ped Ped Yes The pedestrian from whom the NPC will flee. No 2 distance number No The distance within which the NPC will start fleeing. Defaults to 200.0 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the pedestrian and is fleeing. 2 The NPC starts fleeing from the pedestrian.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Coward 
  model a_m_y_hipster_02 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    flee player 150.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC flee from specified coordinates if they are within a certain distance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate from which the NPC will flee. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate from which the NPC will flee. No 3 z number Yes The Z coordinate from which the NPC will flee. No 4 distance number No The distance within which the NPC will start fleeing. Defaults to 200.0 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the coordinates and is fleeing. 2 The NPC starts fleeing from the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Runner 
  model a_m_y_runner_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    fleeCoords 150.0 200.0 10.0 150.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Forces an interaction between the NPC and a nearby player. If blockForceInteraction has been used on a player, the NPC won't interact with that player until unblockForceInteraction is used.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The interaction was not successful. 2 The interaction was successful.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name AggressiveNPC 
  model s_m_y_dealer_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    tell "Hey, you!" 

  behaviour 
    forceInteraction

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Finds the closest player to the NPC within a specified distance and stores the player entity in a global variable.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 player Entity Yes The global variable name where the player entity will be stored. No 2 distance number No The maximum distance to search for a player. Defaults to 200 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The closest player was found and stored in the global variable. 2 No player was found within the specified distance.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Watcher 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer closestPlayer 15

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Finds the closest vehicle to the NPC within a specified distance, optionally filtered by model and flag, and stores the vehicle entity in a global variable.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 vehicle Entity Yes The global variable name where the vehicle entity will be stored. No 2 distance number Yes The maximum distance to search for a vehicle. No 3 model string No The model of the vehicle to filter the search. If not specified, any model is accepted. No 4 flag number No An optional flag to further filter the vehicle search. Defaults to 0 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The closest vehicle was found and stored in the global variable.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Driver 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestVehicle closestVehicle 1000

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves the NPC's current melee combat target and stores the target entity in a global variable.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 target Entity Yes The global variable name where the combat target entity will be stored. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The combat target was found and stored in the global variable. 2 No combat target was found.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Fighter 
  model g_m_y_ballaorig_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getCombatTarget combatTarget

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves a global state associated with the NPC and stores it in a global variable within the behavior tree."

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 k string Yes The key of the global state to retrieve. No 2 output string Yes The name of the global variable where the retrieved state will be stored. No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    getGlobalState npc_hapiness npc_hapiness 
      tell "Im like $npc_hapiness% happy." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves a local state associated with the NPC and the specific player, then stores it in a local variable within the behavior tree.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 k string Yes The key of the local state to retrieve. No 2 output string Yes The name of the local variable where the retrieved state will be stored. No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    getLocalState npc_relationship player_relationship 
      tell "Your relationship with this NPC is $player_relationship." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves an NPC by its ID from the NPC repository and stores it in a global variable.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 name NPC Yes The global variable name where the retrieved NPC will be stored. No 2 id string Yes The unique identifier of the NPC to retrieve. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC was found and stored in the global variable. 2 The NPC with the specified ID was not found.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Helper 
  model s_m_m_paramedic_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getNPC helperNPC npc_id_example

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Gives a specified item and quantity from the NPC to the character.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 item string Yes The identifier of the item to be given. No 2 quantity integer Yes The quantity of the item to be given. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The item was successfully given. 2 The item could not be given.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    give potion 3 
      tell "The NPC gives you 3 potions." 
      tell "The NPC couldn't give you the item." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets a new waypoint on the map at the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate where the waypoint will be set. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate where the waypoint will be set. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 A new waypoint was set at the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guide 
  model s_m_m_tourist_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    giveUbication 250.0 350.0 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks if a global state for the NPC is already marked. If not marked, it sets the state and returns 1; if already marked, it returns 2.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 k string Yes The key of the global state to check or set. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The global state was not marked and has been set. 2 The global state was already marked.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    globalCheck quest_started 
      tell "The quest has just been marked as started." 
      tell "The quest was already marked as started." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC move towards the closest player within a specified distance and speed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 distance number No The maximum distance to search for a player. Defaults to 15 if not specified. No 2 speed number No The speed at which the NPC should move towards the player. Defaults to 2.0 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is in player's proximity. 2 The NPC moves towards the closest player. 3 No player was found within the specified distance.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Follower 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    goToClosestPlayer 15 3.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC move towards the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate to move to. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate to move to. No 3 z number Yes The Z coordinate to move to. No 4 distance number No The stopping distance from the coordinates. If specified and the NPC is within this distance, the action will not move the NPC. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the coordinates. 2 The NPC is moving towards the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Walker 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    goToCoords 150.0 200.0 300.0 10.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC move towards a specified entity within a given distance and speed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 entity Entity Yes The entity that the NPC will move towards. No 2 distance number No The distance at which the NPC will stop moving towards the entity. Defaults to 2.0 if not specified. No 3 speed number No The speed at which the NPC should move towards the entity. Defaults to 2.0 if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the entity. 2 The NPC is moving towards the entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Follower 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    goToEntity player 5.0 3.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC move to a position offset from a specified entity by a given X and Y distance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 entity Entity Yes The entity relative to which the NPC will move. No 2 x number Yes The X offset from the entity's position. No 3 y number Yes The Y offset from the entity's position. No 4 relative boolean No Whether the offset is relative to the entity's heading. Defaults to false if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified offset distance from the entity. 2 The NPC is moving to the specified offset position relative to the entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 
      goToEntityOffset $player 5.0 0.0 true

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Evaluates a given value as a condition and returns a result based on whether the value is true or false.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 value boolean Yes The value to evaluate. Accepts 'true' or 'false' No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The value is true. 2 The value is false.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    if {2 > 1} 
      tell "This condition is true." 
      tell "This condition is false." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Prompts the player to input a text value, which is then stored in a local variable.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 output string Yes The name of the local variable where the player's input will be stored. No 2 text string Yes The text message that prompts the player for input. No 3 placeholder string No The placeholder text that appears in the input field. Optional. No 4 suggestion string No A suggested input value that appears in the input field. Optional. No 5 maxLength number No The maximum number of characters allowed for the input. Optional. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The player provided input, and it was stored in the local variable. 2 The player canceled the input.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Questioner 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    input playerName "Please enter your name:" "Enter name..." "John Doe" 20 
      tell "Thank you, $playerName!" 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks if the NPC recognizes or knows the character.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 1 if the NPC knows the character. 2 2 if the NPC does not know the character.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    knows 
      tell "The NPC recognizes you." 
      tell "The NPC does not recognize you." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks if a local state for the NPC related to a specific player is already marked. If not marked, it sets the state and returns 1; if already marked, it returns 2.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 k string Yes The key of the local state to check or set. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 1 if the local state was not marked and has been set. 2 2 if the local state was already marked.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    localCheck npc_greeted 
      tell "The NPC has just been greeted." 
      tell "The NPC was already greeted before." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Logs a message to the client's debug console.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 message string Yes The message to be logged. Multiple strings can be concatenated with spaces. Yes

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The message was successfully logged.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Logger 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    log "This is a log message" "for debugging purposes." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC turn to face a specific set of coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate to look at. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate to look at. No 3 z number Yes The Z coordinate to look at. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already facing the specified coordinates. 2 The NPC turns to face the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Watcher 
  model s_m_y_cop_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    lookCoords 150.0 200.0 300.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC turn to face a specified entity.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 entity Entity Yes The entity that the NPC should turn to face. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already facing the specified entity. 2 The NPC turns to face the specified entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Observer 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 
      lookEntity $player

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Displays an action message from the NPC in the chat, typically used for roleplaying purposes.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 message string Yes The components of the action message to be displayed. These will be concatenated with spaces. Yes

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    me "waves his hand" "then smiles" 
      tell "You are so pretty." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name NPC_1 
  model a_m_m_eastsa_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens a specified crafting table interface for the player.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 craftingTableName string Yes The name of the crafting table to open. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The crafting table interface has been closed.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Blacksmith 
  model s_m_y_blacksmith_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    openCraftingTable BlacksmithTable 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens a specified shop interface for the player.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 shopName string Yes The name of the shop to open. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The shop interface was closed successfully.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Merchant 
  model s_m_m_shopkeeper_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    openShop GeneralStore 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens a specified storage interface for the player.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 storageName string Yes The name of the storage to open. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The storage interface was closed successfully.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name WarehouseKeeper 
  model s_m_m_warehouse_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    openStorage WarehouseStorage 
      tell "You can access the storage here." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Plays a specified animation on the NPC.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 animDict string Yes The animation dictionary containing the animation to play. https://forge.plebmasters.de/animations/ No 2 animName string Yes The name of the animation to play. https://forge.plebmasters.de/animations/ No 3 duration number No The duration for which the animation should play in milliseconds. If not specified, the animation plays indefinitely. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The animation has finished playing on the NPC. 2 The animation is playing on the NPC.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Dancer 
  model a_f_y_dancer_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    playAnimation amb@world_human_partying@female@partying_beer@base base

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Checks if the NPC is currently playing a specified animation.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 entity Entity Yes The entity whose animation state is being checked. No 2 animDict string Yes The animation dictionary of the animation to check. https://forge.plebmasters.de/animations/ No 3 animName string Yes The name of the animation to check. https://forge.plebmasters.de/animations/ No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is currently playing the specified animation. 2 The NPC is not playing the specified animation.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Performer 
  model a_m_y_musclbeac_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    playingAnimation amb@world_human_partying@female@partying_beer@base base 
      tell "I'm in the middle of a performance." 
      tell "I'm not performing right now." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Removes a specified item and quantity from the NPC to the character.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 item string Yes The identifier of the item to be removed. No 2 quantity integer Yes The quantity of the item to be removed. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The item was successfully removed. 2 The item could not be removed.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    remove potion 3 
      tell "The NPC removes you 3 potions." 
      tell "The NPC couldn't remove." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Ends the current action sequence and returns a specified result.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 result number Yes The result value to return and end the action sequence. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The specified result is returned, ending the action sequence.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name DecisionMaker 
  model a_m_m_business_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    return 1 
      tell "Here's the result." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Logs a message to the server console with the 'Action' tag for debugging purposes.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 string 1 No 1 No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    serverLog "Player entered area" "with ID" 12345 
      tell "Logging player entry to the server." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets multiple global variables within the behavior tree.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 varied 1 No 1 No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    set playerHealth 100 playerMana 50 
      tell "Player health and mana have been set." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets the NPC's position to the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate to set the NPC's position to. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate to set the NPC's position to. No 3 z number Yes The Z coordinate to set the NPC's position to. No 4 distance number No The maximum distance within which the NPC's position should not be set. If the NPC is within this distance from the specified coordinates, the action will not move the NPC. Optional parameter. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the coordinates. 2 The NPC's position was set to the specified coordinates.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Teleporter 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    setCoords 150.0 200.0 300.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets a global state for the NPC.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 k string Yes The key of the state to set. No 2 v any Yes The value to set for the given key. No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    setGlobalState npcMood happy 
      tell "The NPC's mood has been set to happy." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets a local state for the NPC related to a specific player.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 k string Yes The key of the state to set. No 2 v any Yes The value to set for the given key. No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    setLocalState questComplete true 
      tell "Quest completion status has been set." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets the NPC's walking style to the specified animation set.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 walk string Yes The walking style to apply to the NPC. This should be the name of an animation set (e.g., 'move_f@scared'). No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC's walking style was successfully set.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Walker 
  model a_m_m_business_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    setWalk move_f@scared

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Initiates a quest for the NPC. This action handles starting, rewarding, or failing the quest depending on the player's progress.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 quest string Yes The name or ID of the quest to be initiated. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The quest was already completed, and the player received the reward. 2 The quest was already completed, and the reward is given now. 3 The quest has already been attempted and failed. 4 The quest has started successfully. 5 The quest is already in progress. 6 The player declined to start the quest. 7 The quest could not be started due to an error.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name QuestGiver 
  model a_m_m_farmer_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    startQuest quest_example 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Positions the NPC around a specified entity, calculating an offset based on the number of people surrounding and the NPC's position among them.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 entity Entity Yes The entity to surround. No 2 people integer Yes The total number of people surrounding the entity. No 3 position integer Yes The position of the NPC among the people surrounding the entity (1-based index). No 4 radius number Yes The radius of the circle formed by the surrounding people. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC has moved to the designated position and is now facing the entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard1 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 15 
      surround $player 3 1 5.0 

  NPC 

  name Guard2 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1018.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 15 
      surround $player 3 2 5.0 

  NPC 

  name Guard3 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1022.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer player 15 
      surround $player 3 3 5.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Teleports the NPC to the specified entity if the entity is not within a certain distance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 entity Entity Yes The entity to which the NPC will teleport. No 2 distance number No The maximum distance at which teleportation won't occur. If the NPC is within this distance from the entity, no teleportation happens. Defaults to nil if not specified. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC is already within the specified distance from the entity. 2 The NPC teleports to the specified entity.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Teleporter 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    getClosestPlayer closestPlayer 15 
      teleport $closestPlayer 10

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Displays a message to the player from the NPC.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 text string Yes The message text that the NPC will display to the player. No 2 timeout number No The duration in milliseconds for which the message should be displayed. If not specified, the message is displayed indefinitely. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The message was successfully displayed to the player.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Informant 
  model a_m_m_business_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    tell "The secret entrance is behind the waterfall." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Allows an NPC to force an interaction with a specific character again by unblocking it.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
interaction 
    unblockForceInteraction 
      tell "This NPC can now force interactions with you again." 

  behaviour 
    nothing

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Pauses the NPC's behaviour for a specified duration.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 duration number Yes The duration of the wait in milliseconds. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC wait finished. 2 The NPC is waiting.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Guard 
  model s_m_m_security_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    wait 5000

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Makes the NPC wander within a specified area, randomly moving around a central point.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: # Name Type Mandatory Description Multiple 1 x number Yes The X coordinate of the central point. No 2 y number Yes The Y coordinate of the central point. No 3 z number Yes The Z coordinate of the central point. No 4 radius number Yes The radius within which the NPC will wander. No 5 minDistance number Yes The minimum distance the NPC will move in each step. No 6 timeWaiting number Yes The time the NPC will wait before moving to a new position. No

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: # Description 1 The NPC starts wandering around the specified area.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name Explorer 
  model a_m_m_farmer_01 
  position 200.0 300.0 20.0 

  interaction 
    nothing 

  behaviour 
    wander 200.0 300.0 20.0 50.0 10.0 5.0

docs.title: Command Arg Types
docs.text: Name Description achievement An achievement id. any Any type of argument. character A character, can be a source, user discord id, user real id, character real id or character NID. clockHours A number between 0 and 23. clockMinutes A number between 0 and 59. clockSeconds A number between 0 and 59. item An item id. npc A NPC id. number A number, can be negative, decimal or integer. Depends in context. permission A permission string. Format: context.action.id. id is optional. Example: Command.tpm permissionGroup A permission group id. positive A positive number. quantity A positive integer number. questData A quest data id. The name of the quest. recipe A recipe id. string A string, can be any text allowing spaces. user A user, can be a source, discord id or real id. vehicle A valid vehicle model name can get from https://docs.fivem.net/docs/game-references/vehicle-models/. weather A valid weather name. Can be CLEAR, OVERCAST, EXTRASUNNY, CLOUDS, CLEARING, RAIN, NEUTRAL, THUNDER, SMOG, FOGGY, SNOWLIGHT, SNOW, BLIZZARD, XMAS. zone A zone id.

docs.title: Constructors
docs.text: Name Description NPC Creates an NPC in the world that can be interacted with a defined behaviour tree. OBJECT Creates an object in the world that can be interacted with a defined behaviour tree. QUEST Creates a quest thats gives a reward when completed.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates an NPC in the world that can be interacted with a defined behaviour tree.

docs.title: Attribute name
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters name Yes The name of the NPC and ID. 1

docs.title: Parameters of name
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Name String The name of the NPC. No

docs.title: Attribute model
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters model Yes The model of the NPC. 1

docs.title: Parameters of model
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Model String The model of the NPC https://docs.fivem.net/docs/game-references/ped-models/ No

docs.title: Attribute position
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters position Yes The position of the NPC. 4

docs.title: Parameters of position
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 X Number The X position of the NPC. No 2 Y Number The Y position of the NPC. No 3 Z Number The Z position of the NPC. No 4 Heading Number The heading of the NPC. No

docs.title: Attribute floating
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters floating No The offset of the floating message. 3

docs.title: Parameters of floating
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 X Number The X offset of the floating message. No 2 Y Number The Y offset of the floating message. No 3 Z Number The Z offset of the floating message. No

docs.title: Attribute marker
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters marker No The marker of the NPC. 20

docs.title: Parameters of marker
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Model number Number The model number as defined in FiveM https://docs.fivem.net/docs/game-references/markers/ No 2 X Number The X position of the marker. No 3 Y Number The Y position of the marker. No 4 Z Number The Z position of the marker. No 5 ScaleX Number The X scale of the marker. No 6 ScaleY Number The Y scale of the marker. No 7 ScaleZ Number The Z scale of the marker. No 8 DirX Number The X direction of the marker. No 9 DirY Number The Y direction of the marker. No 10 DirZ Number The Z direction of the marker. No 11 RotX Number The X rotation of the marker. No 12 RotY Number The Y rotation of the marker. No 13 RotZ Number The Z rotation of the marker. No 14 R Number 0-255 The R color of the marker. No 15 G Number 0-255 The G color of the marker. No 16 B Number 0-255 The B color of the marker. No 17 A Number 0-255 The A color of the marker. No 18 upAndDown Boolean The up and down of the marker. No 19 faceCamera Boolean The face camera of the marker. No 20 rotate Boolean The rotate of the marker. No

docs.title: Attribute blip
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters blip No The blip of the NPC. 3

docs.title: Parameters of blip
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Name String The name of the blip in the map. No 2 Sprite Number The sprite of the blip as defined in https://docs.fivem.net/docs/game-references/blips/#blips. No 3 Color Number The color of the blip as defined in https://docs.fivem.net/docs/game-references/blips/#blip-colors. No

docs.title: Attribute interaction
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters interaction Yes The interaction behaviour tree of the NPC. 1

docs.title: Parameters of interaction
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 InteractionBehaviourTree BehaviourTree The interaction tree of the NPC. No

docs.title: Attribute behaviour
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters behaviour Yes The behaviour tree of the NPC. 1

docs.title: Parameters of behaviour
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 BehaviourTree BehaviourTree The behaviour tree of the NPC. No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NPC 

  name old_man 
  model s_f_m_maid_01 
  position -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 0.0 

  interaction 
    tell "Hi, how are you?" 

  behaviour 
    wander -1020.72 4839.78 258.30 10 5 5

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a quest thats gives a reward when completed.

docs.title: Attribute id
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters id Yes The quest ID. 1

docs.title: Parameters of id
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 ID String The ID of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute name
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters name Yes The name of the quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of name
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Name String The name of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute description
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters description Yes The description of the quest explaining what it's about. 1

docs.title: Parameters of description
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Description String The description of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute author
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters author Yes The author of the quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of author
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Author String The author of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute duration
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters duration Yes The duration of the quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of duration
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Duration Number The approximate duration of the quest in minutes. No

docs.title: Attribute profile
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters profile Yes The profile of players that the mission is aimed at. 1

docs.title: Parameters of profile
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Profile String The profile of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute category
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters category Yes The category of the quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of category
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Category String The category of the quest, use 'SIDE'. No

docs.title: Attribute coords
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters coords No The coordinates of the quest. 3

docs.title: Parameters of coords
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 X Number The X position of the quest. No 2 Y Number The Y position of the quest. No 3 Z Number The Z position of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute theme
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters theme Yes The theme of the quest with one or two words 1

docs.title: Parameters of theme
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Theme String The theme of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute context
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters context Yes The context of the quest that will be given to the players. 1

docs.title: Parameters of context
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Context String The context of the quest. Yes

docs.title: Attribute success
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters success Yes The message that will be shown when the quest is completed. 1

docs.title: Parameters of success
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Success String The success message of the quest. Yes

docs.title: Attribute failure
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters failure Yes The message that will be shown when the quest is failed. 1

docs.title: Parameters of failure
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Failure String The failure message of the quest. Yes

docs.title: Attribute unstoppable
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters unstoppable No If the quest is unstoppable. 1

docs.title: Parameters of unstoppable
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Unstoppable Boolean If the quest is unstoppable. No

docs.title: Attribute required
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters required No The required quests to start this quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of required
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Required Quest ID The required quests to start this quest. No

docs.title: Attribute minParticipants
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters minParticipants No The minimum number of participants. 1

docs.title: Parameters of minParticipants
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 MinParticipants Number The minimum number of participants. No

docs.title: Attribute maxParticipants
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters maxParticipants No The maximum number of participants. 1

docs.title: Parameters of maxParticipants
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 MaxParticipants Number The maximum number of participants. No

docs.title: Attribute participants
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters participants if not 1

docs.title: Parameters of participants
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Participants Number The number of participants. No

docs.title: Attribute goals
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters goals Yes The goals of the quest defined as a tree. 1

docs.title: Parameters of goals
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 GoalsTree GoalsTree The goals of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute impediments
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters impediments No The impediments of the quest defined as a tree. 1

docs.title: Parameters of impediments
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 ImpedimentsTree ImpedimentsTree The impediments of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute rewards
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters rewards No The rewards of the quest defined as a list. 1

docs.title: Parameters of rewards
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 RewardsList RewardsList The rewards of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute requirements
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters requirements No The requirements of the quest defined as a list that reprensent something that all players must have to start quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of requirements
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 RequirementsList RequirementsList The requirements of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute uniqueRequirements
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters uniqueRequirements No The unique requirements of the quest defined as a list that reprensent something at least one player in group must have to start quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of uniqueRequirements
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 UniqueRequirementsList UniqueRequirementsList The unique requirements of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute conditions
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters conditions No The conditions of the quest defined as a list that represent some global condition not associated directly with players starting quest, must not be breached before starting or during the quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of conditions
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 ConditionsList ConditionsList The conditions of the quest. No

docs.title: Attribute limit
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters limit No The time limit to finish quest when it started. 1

docs.title: Parameters of limit
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 Limit Number The limit of the quest in minutes. No

docs.title: Attribute compensations
docs.text: Name Required Description Parameters compensations No The compensations of the quest defined as a list that represent what players must give to be able to start quest. 1

docs.title: Parameters of compensations
docs.text: # Name Type Description Multiple 1 CompensationsList CompensationsList The compensations of the quest. No

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
MISION 

  id example_quest 
  name "Talk to Mark and Mike" 
  description "Talk to Mark and Mike" 
  duration 10 
  author Sergiolp 
  profile Anybody 
  theme General 
  category SIDE 
  context "Talk to Mark and Mike" "Avoid talking to Steven" 
  success "Congratulations! You have completed the quest." 
  failure "You have failed the quest." 
  participants 1 

  goals 
    talkNPC 1 "Talk to Mark" npc=Mark 
      talkNPC (1) "Talk to Mike" npc=Mike 

  impediments 
    talkNPC 1 "Do not talk with Steven" npc=Steven 

  rewards 
    item 1 water 
    money 50 

  requirements 
    money 50 
  limit 10 

  compensations 
    item 1 water

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description name The achievement name. label The achievement label. description The achievement description. Must contain %s if the achievemnt depends in more than one count. icon The achievement icon. Can be relative within assets folder or an absolute URL. event The event that will trigger the achievement. May require additional parameters depending on the event. count An array of quantities sorted from the lowest to the highest tier. Corresponds to the number of times the event must be triggered to unlock the achievement in its respective tier.

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description name The crafting table name used also as label. items An array of recipes that can be crafted in this crafting table.

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description name The item name. label The item label. description The item description. icon The item icon. Can be relative within assets folder or an absolute URL. category The item category. It will be used to group items in the inventory. weight The item weight. stackAmount The item maximum stack amount in one slot. isUnique The item is unique then it can't be stacked. isRare The item is rare. isTradeable The item is tradeable between players. isAuctionable The item is auctionable. sellPrice The item sell price. buyPrice The item buy price. isUsable The item is usable. use If the item is usable, the use determines the action when the item is used. Using aditional params that this action may be required. isIllegal The item is illegal. tags The item tags as an array of strings.

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description context Contextual name of the permission. action Action that the permission allows. name The permission name used as label. description Description of the permission.

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description name The recipe name that corresponds to the item name that will be created. requirements The recipe requirements as an array of items with name and quantity. time The recipe crafting time. maxQuantity The recipe maximum quantity that can be crafted.

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description name The shop name used also as label. items An array of items that can be bought and sold in this shop. The items must be registered in the items file with its buy and sell prices. If price is 0, the item can't be bought or sold depending on the context.

docs.title: Params
docs.text: Name Description name The zone name. points An array of points that define the zone. Each point is a table with x and y. They come from PolyZone output. options An optional table with minZ, maxZ and debugGrid. utilities An optional table with utilities to give special features to the zone. requirements An optional table with requirements to be inside the zone. Use achievements, quests or items as an array to define the needed requirements. Consider items is an array of objects defining name and quantity for each item.
